title: Grade 3
subject: Extended Content Standards For English Language Arts (2017-)

document.title: North Carolina EXTENDED CONTENT STANDARDS English Language Arts K-12

8E63B99BA77C42BDAC94325154B74325.description: Use words acquired through conversations, being read to, and during shared reading activities.

D9F5954D1FD14BC5BE8F1E01C59B3618.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.6 – Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for
reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in developing vocabulary
knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

EB8ED1ADED764A9A9C1FF3D3F4705C5C.description: Identify words that describe personal emotional states.

D85BD4979CC24ACCB689BA0B6FAEC1BF.description: Determine the literal meaning of words and phrases in context.

D3A615FB651F44EDB599F0A2B444E8CB.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and use.

FA8846D37DFF45BA88ABCA5A11ACD1A1.description: CCR Anchor Standard L.5 – Demonstrate understanding of figurative language and nuances in word meanings.

A3366AA107EB4A49B474B9C89EF949DB.description: Demonstrate knowledge of word meanings drawn from grade 3 content.

B49CC9D9AD4E4CC8B0E51C80B724B23E.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.4 – Determine and clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context
clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

30468C010D22436A8A7581B1411DB374.description: Use language to achieve desired outcomes when communicating to make simple request, comment, or share information.

131C57524EAE4C6EB5C2BEE5ADFDCA14.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.3 – Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective
choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully reading or listening.

3A1AF97214EE401AB5BF4633258B010E.description: Demonstrate emerging understanding of conventions of standard English during shared writing within 2-3 conventions continuum when writing.

A4FFA76F4E08425DAD0657653EE5329D.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.2 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when
writing; demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band conventions continuum.

C1AEAD8C683F4BD4AA96434DBF96A06B.description: Demonstrate understanding of letter and word use within the 2-3 grammar continuum when writing or communicating.

740D7C7BDEA94CF98165ADBE007B4D64.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.1 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking;
demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band grammar continuum.

AF744B820AB74F58AFADFDCDC13AB8A2.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.6 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

878E86401FE341BCB86B3A9522E81661.description: Create a multimedia presentation of a story or poem.

836E0827FB2D46E49DA4BEB7333654C6.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.5 – Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance
understanding of presentations.

F82FAB1B4E304DABB5ABDD00FBD0CB01.description: Communicate opinion on a familiar topic or text including descriptive words.

A8C64B82E5D6471E9EE45E10490529BA.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.4 – Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning
and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

18DAAC6387654DC791DE21AB916523ED.description: Answer who, what, and where questions about the details provided by the speaker.

D15F3F6E925B4C9CA39445CD72937D0E.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.3 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

83E9D6C689C04A9A8290CED95C38F075.description: Identify details in a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media.

E9F8E9C31BF547D381A2109ABD676C8A.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.2 – Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively,
and orally.

A3918942D56D4F0EA8E56FC5F3BA75CA.description: Indicate confusion or lack of understanding about information presented.

5EBD42E0332847C9A8B45B6D5ADE0796.description: Listen to others’ ideas before responding.

59E0E24C9CFE48B78FFE8F488DCA466B.description: Engage in collaborative interactions about texts.

47A5B6624BB24291AA33360DA9596A16.description: Communicate with others in group interactions.

C689CCC0735B484C910C89C495D545E1.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.1 – Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners,
building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

4D38A5272D1D42E795B693D7E5EC9C16.description: Integrated into Standards W.1, W.2, and W.3

0E1DD63AC86F4E7E98916C49B2D8CBC7.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.10 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and
revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

6848475EE3C946CFBEE40DB1416009D7.description: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

9014FEED1E6A4515B076062C2083BB5A.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.9 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection,
and research. Proposed: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

A9F4DC0B51034DAE8E84715D401559AC.description: Sort information on a topic or personal experience into two provided categories and write about each one.

5431404F133848FC897A4E84714246E2.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.6 (from Proposed Standards – was W.8 in 2010 Standards) – Gather relevant information from multiple print and
digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

453CDCAAF00644B0BDB5518D553AAF64.description: Identify information about a topic for a research project.

EAC53CA60E83416C935A66B51E660966.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.5 (from Proposed Standards – was W.7 in 2010 Standards) – Conduct short as well as more sustained research
projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

7E98CB9951824CFB8EBC5E64E8B7063C.description: With guidance and support from adults, use digital tools to produce writing while interacting and collaborating with others.

7EAB150F65984C66BE1D594CDE71E8E6.description: CR Anchor Standard W.4: Use digital tools and resources to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

6A642C17717D41A2ACA2D00426846A6E.description: Write about an event or personal experience, including the names of people involved.

B97E6B209DA34930B442F803F4CBFDF4.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.3 – Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen
details, and well-structured event sequences.

B877C2E3955B4FD8A36F3607F30B8D27.description: Write to share information by selecting a topic and writing about it, including one or more facts or details.

6BA01071136348A5B59F840B24F3BF64.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.2 – Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and
accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

8640133BE95143638117CFFF7BF6D83D.description: Write one or more reasons to support the opinion.

459824F5ED294255B0C799997192FCB8.description: Select a topic or text and write an opinion about it.

122E34B47FBE4A3588B000426C07D811.description: Write an opinion on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons.

7B0C3473EEE7418DB004EF36BE93B911.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.1 – Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and
relevant and sufficient evidence.

4D8C743A32D34BE085ABC3F59A3E2ECB.description: Use context to determine missing words in familiar texts.

FECB556ACC784BEE88B35D92419B99F5.description: Engage in purposeful reading of familiar text.

935B22AA378149E19D0DF43EDC05FEED.description: Apply letter-sound knowledge to begin decoding words."

5C9C48DFAE9A45788DD723806F07755E.description: Uses letters to create written documents."

FBF5753568CF4FAEA518D539026106B7.description:
Actively engage in reading of information text for sustained periods of time for the purpose of connecting prior knowledge and experiences to
text.

C88D798E3ECC40F0BD76268FA08ED1F3.description:
CR Anchor Standard RI.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting prior
knowledge and experiences to text.

4B1EABB9D38644D281C156CFDA89B143.description: Identify a common element between two familiar texts on the same topic.

C1877724B57F4185B15E607ADE9A5615.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare
the approaches the authors take.

4A6C888B5CC34CD982A0011551B9A626.description: Identify two related points an author makes in a familiar informational text.

1115410D98CF40D185C6455E27818AED.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

7778952D502D47C2B62432D859B4C4EF.description: Use information gained from illustrations and the words in a text to answer who and what questions.

8438F8BF3AA44D9486C3540C6BF110B9.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

FDB29F658EEB4CFF8EC0308AEDBAC842.description: Identify personal point of view about a text.

6FB08432841E48B7AF31272617686A3B.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.6: Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

39E0BCF5391649C98C73403728D51602.description: Locate key facts or information in a familiar text.

0D23E3D40584494FA25A9514361D43E3.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

9E75B3CE74DA48FDAA949C59521AD2E8.description: Identify key words that complete sentences in a text

578765B5F7D7443E81BB5898099967B8.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning
or tone.

034C08BD41DC429AB56997A2438197FC.description: Order two events from a text as “first” and “next.”

8EA298015D7640B68085E3358A7D6FA5.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.3 – Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

2E2457594EA6461E8DC1CB2D47631050.description: Identify the main topic and retell key details of a text."

8502755610414411B7B5464C5555255D.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.2 – Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

84FA6FB0586F48AF8C9F7659BAA698FA.description: Answer who and what, where, questions to demonstrate understanding of details in a text.

E9099145B347476D858BCDB18B64D9DC.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

5BC9CA3552D94C1AA1046C4CC8AA5CC9.description: Actively engage in reading for the purpose of connecting prior knowledge and experiences to text for sustained periods of time

B06DCE1CA105400E8808FAF8134141D8.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting
prior knowledge and experiences to text.

B9CA1BA8D48C4D858EA7C052170F8D24.description: Identify common elements in two stories in a series.

05907E633B204E80981A7675C1EE2985.description:
CCRAnchorStandardRL.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the
approaches the authors take.

3BF2A483ED3F4F679E90F52B4925891B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

D46BB1EBD0EF4DE986E8641BDB6DA091.description: Identify parts of illustrations or tactual information that depicts a particular setting or event.

A7BE0D1E6C9F4B1B819671FE0DD1F5E8.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

6D5385D8B9024A6D86BDDD59F9B4C7AE.description: Identify personal point of view about a text.

E186E96E634D4A4D8C39E0BF04625BC4.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.6 Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

52C0D3353422490AB307143D64FE89D3.description: Determine the beginning, middle, and end of a familiar story in order.

D32FECC3CB1D4584B21728D82552A70F.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

4093BD10208F46A79A896325497251B8.description: Determine words and phrases that complete sentences in a text.

A7A19398EFBF4695B34532BDE3E6716A.description: RL.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

0070B0EC0C95455786470F7CED449701.description: Identify the feeling of characters in a story

B9B082CF26144B0C9C37F70C6F07F02C.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.3 –Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

D6132ACFC0E74A7CB69867842280406A.description: Associate details with events in stories from diverse cultures.

85A93AE7C9D140D0B3579AEDBC756324.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.2 –Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

55192A8870654D2A834D8F938CA1049F.description: Answer who and what questions to demonstrate understanding of details in a familiar text.

17E6850300904E979C9F0FD0F79634CA.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
